intro: Bupleurum commelynoideum var. commelynoideum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. This species thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
